text: Harlowton is a city of Montana in the United States. It is the county seat of Wheatland County. About 1,000 people lived there in 2020. Harlowton was founded in 1900 as a station stop on the Montana Railroad. Harlowton is surrounded by the Crazy, Little Belt and Big Snowy Mountains, which are a part of the Lewis and Clark National Forest. ==References== Category:Cities in Montana Category:County seats in Montana Category:1900 establishments in the United States
title: Harlowton, Montana
